nodes.title: Non-Cessation and Chaos/Order Question
nodes.summary: Introduces non-cessation and the chaos/order problem.

invariants.name: Non-cessation recurrence
invariants.definition: If non-cessation is assumed, then recurrence-through-differentiation must remain invariant under re-description; otherwise the claim collapses. (regime_marker)

discriminators.name: Order/chaos split probe
discriminators.how_to: Observable: narrative closure versus regress when order/chaos accounts are recursively restated. Split criterion: keep when recurrence yields stable closure without forcing an ultimate substrate; reject when explanation enters uncontrolled regress.

nodes.title: Formalization Request and Logic Background
nodes.summary: Requests rigor and notes logic training.

invariants.name: Chart stability
invariants.definition: Commitments remain intact across formal and narrative restatements. (budget)

discriminators.name: Formalization boundary test
discriminators.how_to: Observable: primitive budget / silent premise count after formal restatement. Split criterion: pass only when formalization preserves entailments without increasing primitive count; fail when any new primitive or hidden axiom is required to recover the claim.

nodes.title: Question on Wilson Loops
nodes.summary: Asks for conceptual interpretation of Wilson loops.

invariants.name: Loop residue
invariants.definition: Closed-loop comparison yields a stable residual under gauge re-description. (discriminator)

discriminators.name: Loop residue test
discriminators.how_to: Observable: loop/closure residue after local gauge rewrites. Split criterion: keep when closed-loop residue remains measurable; reject when signal is removable by local chart choice. Orthogonality note: this test targets closure-stable residue magnitude, not operator-class admissibility or unit-scaling behavior.

nodes.title: Question About Physical Rules
nodes.summary: Frames laws as emergent from inversion history.

invariants.name: Rule survival under inversion
invariants.definition: If rule-formation-through-inversion is assumed, then survivor-structure must remain invariant under re-description; otherwise the claim collapses. (regime_marker)

discriminators.name: Rule survivor split
discriminators.how_to: Observable: dependency chain of rule-survivors across inversion cycles. Split criterion: keep when survivor rules remain derivable from prior distinctions; reject when inversion forces discontinuous rule resets.

nodes.title: Gravity as the First Force?
nodes.summary: Raises gravity’s primacy and weakness.

invariants.name: Constraint primacy
invariants.definition: Geometric constraints remain primary across force/geometry framing shifts. (regime_marker)

discriminators.name: Geometry–force probe
discriminators.how_to: Observable: constraint consistency in geometry-first vs force-first framing. Split criterion: keep when constraints close without external stage assumptions; reject when force framing requires extra background structure.

nodes.title: Magnetism as Initial Distinction?
nodes.summary: Proposes a magnetism analogy to distinction.

invariants.name: Orientation residue
invariants.definition: Closed transport leaves a stable orientation residue. (discriminator)

discriminators.name: Orientation flip residue
discriminators.how_to: Observable: orientation residue after closed transport with polarity flips. Split criterion: keep when orientation residue survives closure; reject when residue disappears under relabeling. Orthogonality note: this test isolates orientation/parity structure rather than generic gauge-equivalence filtering.

nodes.title: Entry Point Leaks and Actionability Request
nodes.summary: Asks for actionable leak analysis.

invariants.name: Seam visibility
invariants.definition: Typed seams remain explicit under entry framing shifts. (glue_key)

discriminators.name: Chart leakage split
discriminators.how_to: Observable: typed seam count under ontic-entry vs epistemic-entry framing. Split criterion: pass only when seam types remain visible and consistently typed across entry framings; fail when framing shifts mask seams or collapse distinct seam types into one label.

nodes.title: Request for Algorithmic Agential Loop
nodes.summary: Requests a structured revision loop.

invariants.name: Ledger consistency
invariants.definition: Ledger updates preserve seam typing across iterations. (budget)

discriminators.name: Ledger loop comparison
discriminators.how_to: Observable: ledger stability / taxonomy drift across loop iterations. Split criterion: keep when seam classes remain stable through iterations; reject when category drift accumulates.

discriminators.name: Adversarial taxonomy robustness probe
discriminators.how_to: Observable: taxonomy drift under adversarial relabeling. Split criterion: stable seam typing vs drift/explosion under perturbation. Transferability: true, because adversarial relabel stress tests can be reused anywhere a typed ledger must remain stable.

nodes.title: Uniform Rescaling Is Undetectable
nodes.summary: Explains why only differential scaling is observable.

invariants.name: Constraint statement
invariants.definition: The rule’s boundary condition stays invariant. (budget)

invariants.name: Allowed/forbidden split
invariants.definition: The permitted vs. disallowed space is preserved. (regime_marker)

discriminators.name: Dimensionless drift probe
discriminators.how_to: Observable: dimensionless drift under uniform rescaling. Split criterion: keep when dimensionless ratios remain invariant; reject when measured drift depends on representational units. Orthogonality note: this test targets scaling sensitivity, not loop-residue closure or polarity effects.

nodes.title: Requirements for a Good Gauge Theory
nodes.summary: Lists formal criteria for gauge consistency.

invariants.name: Constraint statement
invariants.definition: The rule’s boundary condition stays invariant. (budget)

invariants.name: Allowed/forbidden split
invariants.definition: The permitted vs. disallowed space is preserved. (regime_marker)

discriminators.name: Gauge-invariant observable check
discriminators.how_to: Observable: observability equivalence class under gauge transformation. Split criterion: keep only operators stable across gauge-equivalent descriptions; reject gauge-dependent quantities as observables. Orthogonality note: this test classifies admissible operator families, not whether a particular loop residue is non-zero.

nodes.title: Inside/Out/Backwards Meaning
nodes.summary: Derived from P0023, this node captures a core chart move that reorders foundational assumptions and demands explicit discriminators.

invariants.name: Inside/out/backwards mapping
invariants.definition: If inside/out/backwards is assumed as a valid triad, then its mapping polarity must remain invariant under re-description; otherwise the claim collapses. (regime_marker)

discriminators.name: Inside/Out/Backwards definition probe
discriminators.how_to: Observable: stability of inside/out/backwards role-assignment under negation and restatement. Split criterion: keep when role assignment is preserved across charts; reject when negation swaps roles without criterion.

nodes.title: Constraint + Order + Memory
nodes.summary: Derived from P0065, this node captures a core chart move that reorders foundational assumptions and demands explicit discriminators.

invariants.name: Triad coherence
invariants.definition: If constraint-order-memory co-constitution is assumed, then triad inseparability must remain invariant under re-description; otherwise the claim collapses. (regime_marker)

discriminators.name: Constraint-order-memory triad probe
discriminators.how_to: Observable: minimality of primitive commitments needed to keep constraint-order-memory jointly binding. Split criterion: keep when the triad remains jointly required with fixed primitives; reject when one term becomes optional without loss.

nodes.title: Duality as Self-Differentiation
nodes.summary: Derived from P0103, this node captures a core chart move that reorders foundational assumptions and demands explicit discriminators.

invariants.name: Recursive self-differentiation
invariants.definition: If duality is assumed as self-differentiation, then recursive distinction-generation must remain invariant under re-description; otherwise the claim collapses. (regime_marker)

discriminators.name: Self-differentiation recursion probe
discriminators.how_to: Observable: dependency of each distinction on further distinctions in recursive self-differentiation. Split criterion: keep when recursion sustains differentiation without terminal identity freeze; reject when recursion collapses into static binaries.

nodes.title: Ground as Structured Differentiation
nodes.summary: Derived from P0118, this node captures a core chart move that reorders foundational assumptions and demands explicit discriminators.

invariants.name: Structured differentiation ground
invariants.definition: If ground is assumed as structured differentiation, then non-substantive relationality must remain invariant under re-description; otherwise the claim collapses. (regime_marker)

discriminators.name: Ground-as-structure probe
discriminators.how_to: Observable: stability of ground claims under negative versus positive restatement. Split criterion: keep when ground remains a relation of differentiation; reject when restatement reifies ground as a thing.

nodes.title: Gravity as Persistent Self-Relation
nodes.summary: Derived from P0124, this node captures a core chart move that reorders foundational assumptions and demands explicit discriminators.

invariants.name: Persistent self-relation
invariants.definition: Gravity is interpreted as a stable self-relation constraint. (glue_key)

discriminators.name: Gravity-as-relation probe
discriminators.how_to: Observable: persistence of self-relation signatures across coordinate/model restatements. Split criterion: keep when relation remains intrinsic across charts; reject when it only appears in one framing.

nodes.title: Existence as Continual Difference
nodes.summary: Derived from P0146, this node captures a core chart move that reorders foundational assumptions and demands explicit discriminators.

invariants.name: Continual difference
invariants.definition: If existence is assumed as continual difference, then ongoing differentiation output must remain invariant under re-description; otherwise the claim collapses. (regime_marker)

discriminators.name: Continual difference probe
discriminators.how_to: Observable: narrative closure behavior of continual-difference claims under repeated identity pressure. Split criterion: keep when difference-production remains open-ended yet coherent; reject when closure requires reinstating fixed identity.

nodes.title: Negative Ground Statement
nodes.summary: Derived from P0184, this node captures a core chart move that reorders foundational assumptions and demands explicit discriminators.

invariants.name: Negative ground constraint
invariants.definition: If ground is assumed only in negative form, then non-positivizability must remain invariant under re-description; otherwise the claim collapses. (regime_marker)

discriminators.name: Negative ground boundary probe
discriminators.how_to: Observable: boundary stability of negative-ground language under attempted positive completion. Split criterion: keep when negation remains constitutive of the ground claim; reject when positive completion becomes required.

nodes.title: Division as Irreducible Process
nodes.summary: Derived from P0198, this node captures a core chart move that reorders foundational assumptions and demands explicit discriminators.

invariants.name: Irreducible division
invariants.definition: If division is assumed as primitive, then irreducibility under composition-first re-description must remain invariant; otherwise the claim collapses. (regime_marker)

discriminators.name: Division irreducibility probe
discriminators.how_to: Observable: minimality of primitive commitments in division-first versus composition-first descriptions. Split criterion: keep when division remains primitive under reformulation; reject when division is derivable from composition plus bookkeeping.

nodes.title: No Global Time Direction
nodes.summary: Derived from P0217, this node captures a core chart move that reorders foundational assumptions and demands explicit discriminators.

invariants.name: Local arrow stability
invariants.definition: Local arrows persist without a privileged global direction. (regime_marker)

discriminators.name: No-global-time-direction probe
discriminators.how_to: Observable: local arrow persistence after global timeline re-indexing. Split criterion: keep when local directionality survives without a global arrow; reject when a global direction is required.

discriminators.name: Local-arrow persistence scatter test
discriminators.how_to: Observable: cross-context persistence of arrow-like asymmetry under chart shifts. Split criterion: arrow arises only from local coarse-graining vs requires a global orientation constraint. Transferability: true, because cross-context arrow-persistence checks can be reused wherever local asymmetry must be distinguished from globally imposed direction.

nodes.title: Intentionality Without Desire
nodes.summary: Derived from P0158, this node captures a core chart move that reorders foundational assumptions and demands explicit discriminators.

invariants.name: Search-space bias
invariants.definition: Intentionality arises as bias under constraint without desire. (discriminator)

discriminators.name: Intentionality-without-desire probe
discriminators.how_to: Observable: bias emergence in constrained search without desire terms. Split criterion: keep when directional behavior appears from structure alone; reject when intrinsic desire primitives are necessary.

nodes.title: Procedural admissibility → Ontological admissibility bridge
nodes.summary: Formalizes the handoff from method-valid moves to ontology-admissible claims as an explicit chart translation step with no silent upgrade.

invariants.name: No silent upgrade across handoff
invariants.definition: If a move is licensed only procedurally, it cannot become ontic without an explicit interface variable; otherwise the handoff collapses.

discriminators.name: Admissibility handoff scatter test
discriminators.how_to: Observable: what changes when we translate 'procedure-valid' into 'ontology-admissible'. Split criterion: handoff preserves seam visibility vs handoff reifies method outcomes as ontology.

discriminators.name: A10 stub for Q000021
discriminators.how_to: Observable: TODO define measurable axis from task hotspot. Split criterion: TODO define pass/fail boundary with explicit seam condition.

edges.justification: Both frame rule formation as survival under differentiation, indicating a shared L4-style seam between change and persistence.

Interface variable: primitive budget / silent premise. This chart bridge maps formalization checks (Q000002) to entry-point seam marking (Q000007) through the same observable axis: count and type of premises that become implicit after re-description. Counterexample/failure case: a formal rewrite that proves the target claim only by adding an unstated axiom like 'all boundary states are total orders'; the bridge fails because premise inflation is hidden.

Interface variable: ledger stability / taxonomy drift. This bridge translates formal chart commitments (Q000002) into loop execution discipline (Q000008) by tracking whether category labels stay stable across iterations. Counterexample/failure case: iteration 1 labels a seam as 'scope_boundary' but iteration 3 silently relabels the same seam as 'constraint_exception' with no rule update; that drift breaks the bridge.

Interface variable: ledger stability / taxonomy drift. This bridge connects entry-point leak typing (Q000007) to loop updates (Q000008) through the same observable axis: typed-seam retention versus taxonomy drift over repeated passes. Counterexample/failure case: the same entry framing yields seam type 'chart_mismatch' on pass A and 'ontology_gap' on pass B under identical evidence, indicating taxonomy explosion under perturbation.

Interface variable: observability equivalence class. This bridge links Wilson-loop residue framing (Q000003) to gauge-admissible observables (Q000010) by translating local gauge descriptions into the same equivalence class of measurable operators.

Interface variable: dimensionless drift. This bridge connects loop-residue detectability (Q000003) and uniform rescaling limits (Q000009) through the same axis: whether measurable ratios drift after representation-preserving rescaling.

Interface variable: orientation residue. This bridge maps orientation-flip tests (Q000006) onto loop closure diagnostics (Q000003) by checking whether orientation-dependent residue survives closed transport.
Both concern constraint formation and rule survival under inversion without committing to a shared interface variable.

Shared discriminator pattern: interface_scatter. Shared observable axis: loop/closure residue under local gauge re-description. Transfer rationale: Q000003 establishes that non-zero closure residue survives gauge changes only when computed from gauge-invariant operators, not gauge-dependent potentials; Q000010 uses that same split to define the admissible observable class as operators that remain stable across gauge-equivalent charts.

Shared discriminator pattern: orthogonal_probe. Shared observable axis: primitive budget / silent premise count after chart rewrite. Transfer rationale: the split criterion transfers from Q000002 to Q000007 because both nodes test whether re-description keeps assumptions explicit at method boundaries. Counterexample/failure case: a boundary check that appears valid in Q000002 but, when applied to Q000007, reclassifies an entry assumption as 'context' instead of a seam, hiding the same silent premise rather than exposing it.

Shared discriminator pattern: interface_scatter. Shared observable axis: observability equivalence class under uniform rescaling. Transfer rationale: the split criterion transfers from Q000009 to Q000010 because both nodes treat unit-invariant structure as admissible and chart-dependent drift as non-physical. Failure case template: If the observable changes under unit scaling, it is not admissible.

Shared discriminator pattern: orthogonal_probe. Shared observable axis: stability of inside/out/backwards role-assignment under re-description. Transfer rationale: the split criterion transfers from Q000011 to Q000012 because the triad in Q000012 only remains binding when role-assignment invariants are preserved across chart rewrites. Failure counterexample: if a restatement preserves the triad vocabulary but silently swaps inside/out roles, the transfer fails.

Shared discriminator pattern: orthogonal_probe. Shared observable axis: dependency of each distinction on further distinctions in recursive articulation. Transfer rationale: the split criterion transfers from Q000013 to Q000016 because continual-difference claims in Q000016 require the same non-terminal recursion tested in Q000013. Failure counterexample: if recursion terminates in a fixed identity core while still claiming ongoing differentiation, the transfer fails.

Shared discriminator pattern: orthogonal_probe. Shared observable axis: stability of ground claims under negation-versus-posit restatement. Transfer rationale: the split criterion transfers from Q000014 to Q000017 because both nodes require ground to remain relationally constrained rather than positively reified under formal pressure. Failure counterexample: if a positive ground substance is introduced to stabilize the claim, the transfer fails.

Interface variable: local arrow persistence. This bridge translates persistence of relational constraints (Q000015) into arrow persistence claims (Q000019) as a chart translation rather than a discriminator transfer.

Shared discriminator pattern: orthogonal_probe. Shared observable axis: bias emergence under constrained search. Transfer rationale: the split criterion (directed behavior appears from constraint-biased exploration without desire primitives) transfers from Q000020 to Q000016 because both nodes frame persistence as generated by structured differentiation, not fixed essences.

Interface variable: constraint-order coupling. This bridge translates gravity-as-relation framing (Q000015) into structured-ground framing (Q000014) via the same axis: whether ordering constraints are intrinsic to the structure rather than added post hoc.

Interface variable: local arrow persistence. This bridge links no-global-time-direction claims (Q000019) to negative-ground boundary claims (Q000017) by testing whether local directional residues survive global re-indexing.
Shared emphasis on differentiation-driven structure suggests a weak shared-leak relation.
Shared emphasis on differentiation-driven structure suggests a weak shared-leak relation.

Shared discriminator pattern: orthogonal_probe. Shared observable axis: persistence of asymmetric structure under local-to-global reformulation. Transfer rationale: the split criterion from Q000018 (division remains irreducible vs reducible to composition) transfers to Q000019 by testing whether arrow-like asymmetry can be reduced to a global orientation constraint or must persist as a local coarse-grained residue.

Interface variable: ledger stability / taxonomy drift. This bridge translates loop-level procedural stability (Q000008) into handoff admissibility checks (Q000021) by testing whether taxonomy remains stable when moving from process validation to claim admissibility.

Interface variable: primitive budget / silent premise. This bridge translates handoff admissibility constraints (Q000021) into ontology-entry mapping discipline (Q000011) by requiring that no ontic commitment be added without explicit premise accounting.
